Articles.Content:
3 hours ago, Jimbodiah said:

I keep getting crashes with this mod, but don't really see anything in the logs that means anything.

  Hide contents

http://dasher.nl/kerbal/KSP.log

http://dasher.nl/kerbal/output_log.txt

 

 

Be sure to install the latest version from the release thread. I don't really monitor this one anymore. I'll take a look at your crash logs when I get home.

Yep, but now it's maintained by Angel-125. Please have some patience so that he gets a chance to check your problem. Are you sure you got the latest version released by Angel-125? The OP on this thread may contain an obsolete link.

Here is the release thread for the CactEye. Not sure what the crash is, there appears to be a bunch of "Look rotation viewing vector is zero" reports in your logs but I don't know what that's from. Have you tried just the stock game, MechJeb, and the latest CactEye?

Also, it would be a big help to me if people would switch to the release thread for discussions. I don't own this thread, so I can't request for it to be locked. It's fewer thread for me to keep track of that way.

Hello, i have an ultra-wide setup (3840x1024 TH2G) and when i Toggle the telescopes GUI i get a very big window that has the lower corners (usualy where the resize button is) way below the border of my screen and beyond my mouse reach, could you please limit the default size of the window? ill post a screenshot so you get the picture  

 

 

http://imgur.com/a/eA9Xp

so i opened ksp on the default res to get the gui fit in my screen and i noticed it isnt resizeable, so maybe the solution would be limiting the max height/width of the window so it doesnt extends beyond reach, 

regards

Everything appears to be working correctly except for the fact that the results will never transmit.

Example: 250km orbit, looking at Eve, take a picture, GUI comes up saying I've collected ~40 science, press transmit, nothing happens. No exceptions are being thrown.

Any idea whats going on?

Edit: RemoteTech connection was dropping as I was sending signals. My fault!

Edited January 18, 2016 by visivante

In your PlanetaryObservationContract.cfg you have Minmus and Pol is misspelled.  Throws and error when loading the contract configs.  Easy fix, just wanted to make you aware.

 

Thanks for the mod.

Wow, I'm surprised that I'm first one here... but this is an awesome mod, can't wait to see it updated or the 1.1=)
And thanks for all your efforts for supporting it.

On 4/26/2016 at 9:12 PM, Riverey said:

Wow, I'm surprised that I'm first one here... but this is an awesome mod, can't wait to see it updated or the 1.1=)
And thanks for all your efforts for supporting it.

 

7 hours ago, Zefnoly said:

I can't wait either. Haven't gotten a chance to test it properly on a career/science sandbox save yet because i only experimented in 1.0.5 while waiting for 1.1 but i loved what this mod could do. I would really like it in 1.1.2!

Might want to follow the proper dev thread then.  It is updated to 1.1.2 but there is currently a mod stopping bug that keeps you from getting the science UI up and running but the mod will install and not kill your game anymore...

Is there any thought on adding a solar telescope/processor? Since real solar telescopes watch the sun constantly to observe changes, maybe increase science return with time as the telescope watches the sun?
